messages.message: Putting together a POV for Medical Reports and many of the documents are hundreds of pages and between 100 and 200MB. Hitting the limit of a 50mb document being loaded into the converse app.  Is this a hard limit or can it be expanded for a use case?  Is this limit consistent for all tools/environments?

Wow! @Hari is it possible for us to change this limit easily in some environment? 

@Dale DeLoy I’d be curious on the details of the use case on these massive documents.
These documents are for Life and Disability insurance eligibility
I would not consider these massive and there are some in the thousands of pages

Here are the questions they want to ask:
1. What is the date range of the medical records?
2. Providers and their specialties
3. Provide a health history (Diagnosis/condition, Date of Treatment, etc.)
4. Alcohol, Tobacco & Substances abuse?
5. Summary of medical diagnosis (SOAP – Subjective, Objective, Assessment, Plan)
6. Medications (Prescription Name, Dosage, Frequency)
7. Mental & Behavioral Treatment
8. Activities (running, golfing, work activities, traveling etc.)
9. Family History?

Thanks for sharing! 

@Bas - do the insurers typically look for similar things from these medical documents? Does it make sense to evaluate a medical summary app? cc: @avi

Hey @Varun Jain @avi - we started looking into a medical summary app a while ago in the early days of pre release AI Hub. We had some success and even demoed it to customers who liked it. I guess it should perform better now. 

However, a raw capability to summarize is not sufficient - as part of a complete flow we need to have a draft mapping output that aligns with industry standards (and then present the ability to query and change the mapping as an extra). We are competing directly with companies who make these summaries by hand.

Something that produces a real summary ootb at industry standard, and then allows you to further query would fit well in the workflows of underwriters and claims adjusters. Would love your view@Dale DeLoy
Agreed - a nice set of summary fields as the initial part of an app and then allow the underwriter to ask questions like in converse
